result.execSummary:
The defendant Randall I. Majors was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randall I. Majors

Amended

Minutes:  14CF792/14CF1132.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Val Karls.  Cases are resolved.  Victim rights compliance.

14CF792 - amended information filed.  Deft pleads guilty to both counts; found guilty by the Court.  Count 1 - sentenced to 8 days KCJ.  Credit for 8 days served.  Costs rolled in.  Count 2 - fined $200 plus costs.  Bond to apply.

14CF1132 - amended information filed.  Language amended on the amended information.  Deft pleads guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Deft sentenced to 4 days KCJ.  Credit for 4 days.  Costs rolled in.  Bond to be returned to poster.
Email received from Atty Val Karls - case is settled; plea hrg set for 3/2/15 @ 3:45pm.  Attys notified via email

Minutes:  NO RECORD TAKEN.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Val Karls.  Atty Karls reports the case is not settled yet; ADA Burgoyne is assigned to this case presently in trial in this branch.  Parties are to notify the court by 5pm on 2/25/15 if the case is resolved.  No plea bargaining will be allowed after that date.  Leave on for trial for 3/2/15 @ 9am

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Val Karls. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 3. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 2-11-15 @ 10:00am. Jury selection on 3-2-15 @ 9:00am. Bond continued.
Preliminary Hearing Waiver/Plea Offer
to Preliminary Hearing
Preliminary hearing on November 19, 2014 at 09:45 am.
Preliminary hearing rescheduled from 11-11 to 11-19-14 @ 9:45am at the request of Atty. Val Karls. DA's Office notified.
faxed copy filed by Atty. Val Karls

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Karls.  Warrant is vacated.  Bond of $2500 cash to continue.  Initial appearance to be 9/30/14 @ 1pm before the Court Commissioner.  Per Katie in Records, warrant was already cancelled when deputy took the deft from court to the jail.
